intro: Duvalia minuta, commonly known as the dwarf duvalia, is a small flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
